wikipedia_page.main: Colonel William Stephen Brownlow  (9 October 1921 – May 1998) was a British Army officer and Northern Irish Unionist politician.

link_mentions.page: List of political families in the United Kingdom
response: ******William Brownlow (1921–1998), Unionist politician, MP for North Down (1959–62), brother-in-law of the 6th Baron
*Sir William Brownlow, 1st Baronet (c. 1595–1666), English politician and barrister
*Sir William Brownlow, 4th Baronet (1665–1701), British Member of Parliament for Peterborough and Bishop's Castle
*William Brownlow (1683–1739) (1683–1711), Irish MP for Armagh County 1711–1739
*William Brownlow (1726–1794), Irish MP for Armagh County 1753–1794 and Strabane
*William Brownlow (1755–1815), Irish MP for Armagh County 1795–1798, British MP for Armagh
*William Brownlow, 3rd Baron Lurgan (1858–1937), Anglo-Irish aristocrat, landowner, hotel proprietor and sportsman
*William Brownlow (British Army officer) (1921–1998), British Army officer and MP for North Down
*William Brownlow (bishop) (1830–1901), English prelate of the Roman Catholic Church

link_mentions.page: Members of the 1973 Northern Ireland Assembly
Irish Countrysports and Country Life Magazine
response: Over the years, the magazine has carried articles by the most renowned writers in the country sports world with such noted sportsmen as Capt. Jimmy Hamilton, Major William Brownlow, John Beach, Tony Jackson, Michael Twist, Victor Mc Devitt, Steven McGonigal, Albert Titterington and Simon Everett regularly contributing to the magazine.
Brownlow was born in County Monaghan, Ireland, the eldest son of William Brownlow JP and Janet Orme. He was educated at Harrow School and the Royal Military College, Sandhurst.
